title.narrative: F.a: Trade Union Rights in Central America

description.narrative: The project aims at strengthening the capacity of the public sector unions to defend the rights of the workers in this sector and to lobby for the ratification of ILO conventions 151 and 154 in El Salvador and Nicaragua. The rights of public sector workers to organize and to bargain collectively are violated by many ways. Collective bargaining is allowed only to restricted groups of public servants. In Nicaragua, the government tends to intervene in trade union movement by supporting only unions that are al lies to the government. In El Salvador only certain groups of public workers are allowed to join unions, for others it is forbidden. The project strengthens public sector unions and their advocacy capacities so that they can effectively advocate for the ra tification of ILO conventions 151 and 154. The ratification of these conventions would improve the rights of public sector workers and would give an important tool for the unions. The project will improve the capacity of unions and increase the participati on of women and young workers in the unions. The cooperation between unions and other relevant actors (ILO, CSI/CSA, labor centers) will also be improved and better focused. The beneficiaries of the project are the public sector unions, for example in the health sector. If governments do ratify ILO conventions 151 and 154 this will benefit all public sector workers in these countries.
